data.title: ‘The Masked Singer’ reveals for all seasons: Celebrities and costumes through the years
data.meta_description: If you're looking for a refresher on all "The Masked Singer" reveals through the years, you've come to the right place.
data.text:
Antonio Brown as Hippo

Season 1, Episode 1

This NFL player entered “Masked Singer” history when he became the first costumed celebrity to be unmasked in front of America. Brown stumped all four judges after his wacky performance of “My Prerogative” by Bobby Brown.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Odell Beckham Jr.

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Deion Sanders

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Deion Sanders

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Allen Iverson

Tommy Chong as Pineapple

Season 1, Episode 2

This comedic legend said he’s willing to do “anything to get on stage,” and dressing up in a costume while singing “I Will Survive” by Gloria Gaynor was not beneath him. Chong left all four judges up in smoke, although Jenny came close by guessing his frequent co-star, Cheech Marin.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Sugar Ray Lenoard

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Cheech Marin

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Jimmy Buffett

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Kid Rock

Terry Bradshaw as Deer

Season 1, Episode 3

This NFL Hall of Famer won four Super Bowl titles as the quarterback of the Pittsburgh Steelers, but it was when he suited up as the Deer and serenaded viewers with “Get Your Shine On” by Florida Georgia Line that he revealed his hidden singing talent. Despite being known for his prowess on the playing field and not his voice, Bradshaw only fooled half of the judging panel.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Terry Bradshaw

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Peyton Manning

Ken Jeong’s final guess: John Elway

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Terry Bradshaw

Margaret Cho as Poodle

Season 1, Episode 4

This Emmy and Grammy nominated comedian was not joking around when she belted out “Time After Time” by Cyndi Lauper, leaving the judges completely confused about her identity. Although Cho was the singer unmasked, it was Ken who left with his tail between his legs after he failed to guess his own co-star from “Dr. Ken” was hiding inside the Poodle costume.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Judge Judy

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Kathy Griffin

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Melissa Rivers

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Jillian Michaels

Tori Spelling as Unicorn

Season 1, Episode 5

This former teen star from “Beverly Hills 90210” and frequent tabloid headliner took advantage of the anonymity Unicorn provided her while she pranced around the stage singing “I Love It” by Icona Pop. In a rare occurrence, Ken was the only judge able to pin down the Unicorn’s identity before Spelling was unmasked.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Gabby Douglas

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Lauren Conrad

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Tori Spelling

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Denise Richards

Ricki Lake as Raven

Season 1, Episode 6

This actress and Emmy-winning talk show host went through an emotional journey on “The Masked Singer” as she re-emerged into the public eye after the heartbreaking death of her ex-husband. In Lake’s last performance she sang “Brave” by Sarah Bareilles and her clues hinting at being a talk show host were enough to put one panelist on the right track.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Ricki Lake

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Raven-Symone

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Sheryl Underwood

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Meghan McCain

La Toya Jackson as Alien

Season 1, Episode 7

“Thank you so much for supporting me [and] supporting the Alien,” La Toya Jackson said after her dramatic unmasking in the seventh episode of “The Masked Singer.” Backstage after the show wrapped, La Toya said, “This experience was absolutely fabulous. It was wonderful. I enjoyed every single moment of it. It felt wonderful being anonymous. I’m glad that people got the chance to see a different side of my personality.”

Robin’s final guess: La Toya Jackson

Jenny’s final guess: Sofia Richie

Ken’s final guess: Paula Abdul

Nicole’s final guess: La Toya Jackson

Rumer Willis as Lion

Season 1, Episode 8

This Hollywood starlet and eldest daughter of Bruce Willis and Demi Moore wowed the panel week after week with her surprisingly strong vocals. She may have been eliminated earlier than anyone expected, but her rendition of “Don’t You Worry ‘Bout a Thing” by Stevie Wonder stumped all the judges.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Michelle Williams

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Kelly Rowland

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Dawn Robinson

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Hailee Steinfeld

Joey Fatone as Rabbit

Season 1, Episode 8

Best known as a member of the megastar boy band NSYNC, Fatone will be remembered for never breaking character as the neurotic, twitchy Rabbit. In “The Masked Singer,” Fatone proved he is capable of taking the lead vocal, but after his rendition of “My Girl” by The Temptations, the panel was on to him.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Joey Fatone

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Donnie Wahlberg

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Kevin Richardson

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Joey Fatone

Gladys Knight as Bee

Season 1 Finale (Third Place)

This legendary soul diva belted her way into the Season 1 finale and relished the ability to put her spin on modern classics like “Wrecking Ball” by Miley Cyrus. For Knight’s final performance she sang “I Can’t Make You Love Me” by Bonnie Raitt and by that point her unmistakable tone was just too obvious to fool the judges (well, except Ken).

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Gladys Knight

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Glady Knight

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Anita Baker

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Gladys Knight

Donny Osmond as Peacock

Season 1 Finale (Runner-up)

This American icon and former teen idol wasn’t afraid to “Shake a Tail Feather” as he rocked the house to the hit song by The Five Du-Tones. Osmond managed to sing his way to second place in the first season of “The Masked Singer” while befuddling all but one judge.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Weird Al Yankovic

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Donny Osmond

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Neil Patrick Harris

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Neil Patrick Harris

T-Pain as Monster

Season 1 Finale (Winner)

This chart-topping rapper and hit-making producer made history as the first winner of “The Masked Singer.” As the Monster, T-Pain was able to put his singing prowess at the forefront while keeping his identity hidden until the very end. Unfortunately, none of the judges were able to correctly pinpoint his true persona.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Jamie Foxx

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Michael Vick

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Darius Rucker

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: CeeLo Green

Johnny Weir as Egg

Season 2, Episode 1

This two-time Olympic figure skater and fashion designer sizzled as the Egg singing “Just Dance” by Lady Gaga. Despite not being a professional singer, his clues and flamboyant style were enough for half the panel to guess his identity. Weir was the first eliminated from Season 2.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Johnny Weir

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Johnny Weir

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Jonathan Van Ness

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Christian Siriano

Tyler ‘Ninja’ Blevins as Ice Cream

Season 2, Episode 1

This professional YouTuber, gamer and internet personality confused everyone as the funky Ice Cream singing “Old Town Road” by Lil Nas X and Billy Ray Cyrus. He became the second contestant eliminated after just one performance on Season 2, leaving the panelists totally stumped.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: DeadMau5

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Rob Dyrdek

Ken Jeong’s final guess: PewDiePie

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Marshmallow

Laila Ali as Panda

Season 2, Episode 2

This former professional boxer and daughter of the legendary Muhammad Ali shocked everyone when she unmasked following an energetic performance of “Stronger (What Doesn’t Kill You)” by Kelly Clarkson. Ali may have been undefeated in the boxing ring, but she lasted just one episode in “The Masked Singer.”

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Loni Love

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Wanda Sykes

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Queen Latifah

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Venus Williams

Dr. Drew Pinsky as Eagle

Season 2, Episode 3

This television personality and addiction specialist left everyone guessing when he belted out “I’d Do Anything for Love (But I Won’t Do That)” by Meat Loaf. Pinski has been known to work with rock stars, but learned the profession of many of his clients isn’t as easy as it looks.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Howard Stern

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Adam Corolla

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Craig Ferguson

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Jeff Foxworthy

Paul Shaffer as Skeleton

Season 2, Episode 4

This singer, composer, actor and comedian was tired of being known for playing second fiddle to “Late Show” host David Letterman and branched out to entertain the masses on “The Masked Singer.” After his performance of “Are You Gonna Be My Girl” by Jet, half the panel pegged Shaffer as the Skeleton.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Paul Shaffer

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Paul Shaffer

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Martin Short

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Raymond Teller

Sherri Shepherd as Penguin

Season 2, Episode 5

This actress, comedian and former co-host on “The View” dodged early correct guesses of her identity and by the time Shepherd rocked the house to “All About That Bass” by Meghan Trainor the entire panel was confused. Despite having suspicions in earlier weeks, even Jenny couldn’t guess her former co-star was hiding underneath the Penguin mask.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Mindy Kaling

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Nicole Byer

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Wanda Sykes

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Starr Jones

Raven-Symone as Black Widow

Season 2, Episode 6

This comedic actress, singer and rapper was thrilled to enterain audiences anonymously after being in the spotlight since she was a child star on “The Cosby Show.” Following an inspirational performance of “Believe” by Cher, Symone was unmasked after half the judging panel guessed her identity.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Raven-Symone

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Amber Riley

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Miranda Lambert

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Raven-Symone

Kelly Osbourne as Ladybug

Season 2, Episode 7

This television personality and daughter of Ozzy and Sharon Osbourne felt empowered in her Ladybug mask after years of being insecure. Osbourne showed off a rock edge, singing “Youngblood” by 5 Seconds of Summer and was none too thrilled when most of the judging panel thought she was Lindsay Lohan.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Lindsay Lohan

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Paris Jackson

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Lindsay Lohan

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Jamie Lynn Spears

Patti LaBelle as Flower

Season 2, Episode 8

This powerhouse diva was instantly recognized for her unique, legendary tone. The Grammy-winning singer fooled almost no one, but Ken remained adamant Bjork was under the Flower mask, even after LaBelle’s final performance of “Eye of the Tiger” by Survivor.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Patti LaBelle

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Patti LaBelle

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Bjork

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Patti LaBelle

Michelle Williams as Butterfly

Season 2, Episode 9

This gospel singer and member of the iconic girl group Destiny’s Child used “The Masked Singer” as a form of therapy, re-emerging into the limelight after a difficult year. Throughout the season she played with various genres of music, but following her performance of “Sorry Not Sorry” by Demi Lovato, the panel of judges had no question it was Williams (well, except Ken).

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Michelle Williams

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Michelle Williams

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Mel B

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Michelle Williams

Ana Gasteyer as Tree

Season 2, Episode 10

This hilarious actress and “Saturday Night Live” alum proved her voice was no joke as she belted out “The Edge of Glory” by Lady Gaga. Her bizarre Christmas references and powerful vocals confused the panel for weeks, but she wasn’t able to hide her identity for long and half the panel pegged Gasteyer as the Tree.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Amy Sedaris

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Ana Gasteyer

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Bebe Neuwirth

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Amy Sedaris

Victor Oladipo as Thingamajig

Season 2, Episode 11

This NBA All-Star showed off his hidden musical talents on “The Masked Singer” and developed a flirtatious relationship with Nicole, who he brought to tears with his voice. Perhaps more shocking than Oladipo’s voice was the fact that Ken was the only judge to guess his true identity following a performance of “Winter Wonderland” by Bing Crosby.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Montell Jordan

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Paul George

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Victor Oladipo

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Markelle Fultz

Seal as Leopard

Season 2, Episode 11

Nobody on “The Masked Singer” seemed to have more fun getting into character than Seal as the eccentric, royal Leopard. His act threw the panel off for weeks before Seal’s identiry became apparent after his performance of “Big Spender” by Shirley Bassey.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Seal

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Eric Benet

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Jeff Goldblum

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Seal

Adrienne Bailon as Flamingo

Season 2 Finale (Third Place)

This singer and Emmy-winning co-host of “The Real” had taken a break from singing and admitted to being insecure about the sound of her own voice. Her confidence grew each week as the panel gave her encouraging compliments and she managed to make it all the way to the finale. Bailon finished in third place after a scorching hot performance of “Proud Mary” by Tina Turner.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Adrienne Bailon

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Adrienne Bailon

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Jessica Simpson

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Adrienne Bailon

Chris Daughtry as Rottweiler

Season 2 Finale (Runner-up)

This multi-platinum rock singer was no stranger to reality singing competitions after finishing in fourth place on Season 5 of “American Idol.” Hoping to prove he had more musical versatility than his career has shown so far, Daughtry threw on the Rottweiler mask and made it all the way to the finale, finishing in second place. Following his final performance of “Alive” by Sia, the panel still had no clue Daughtry was hiding under the mask.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Darren Criss

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Jason Mraz

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Dave Franco

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Darren Criss

Wayne Brady as Fox

Season 2 Finale (Winner)

This five-time Emmy winner, comedian and Broadway star had developed a plan from day one to confuse the panel and lead them to believe he was Jamie Foxx. As the weeks passed by, Brady wowed viewers with his voice, dance moves and charisma as the Fox. Following his final performance of “Try a Little Tenderness” by Otis Redding, Brady won the Golden Mask and became the Season 2 champion.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Wayne Brady

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Jamie Foxx

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Jamie Foxx

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Wayne Brady

Lil Wayne as Robot

Season 3, Episode 1

This five-time Grammy-winning rapper left jaws on the floor when he was unmasked as the Robot during the Season 3 premiere. Rather than rap, Wayne showed a lesser known side of himself, rocking out to “Are You Gonna Go My Way” by Lenny Kravitz. The panel had no clue Wayne was behind the mask and called it the most shocking reveal to date.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Shaun White

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Johnny Knoxville

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Flavor Flav

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Floyd Mayweather

Drew Carey as Llama

Season 3, Episode 2

This actor, comedian and game show host had everyone guessing as he pranced around crooning “It’s Not Unusual” by Tom Jones in a llama suit. The panel couldn’t believe the host of “The Price is Right” was behind the mask, but Carey admitted he wanted to do the show “for a laugh.”

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Adam Carolla

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Kelsey Grammar

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Joel McHale

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Woody Harrelson

Chaka Khan as Miss Monster

Season 3, Episode 3

This 10-time Grammy winner is known as the Queen of Funk, she but toned things down in hopes of fooling the judges on “The Masked Singer.” After a dramatic performance of “You Don’t Own Me” by Lesley Gore, half of the panel recognized her iconic voice before she was unmasked.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Chaka Khan

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Queen Latifah

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Reba McEntire

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Chaka Khan

Tony Hawk as Elephant

Season 3, Episode 4

This X Games legend and stuntman is the last person most viewers expected to see in a singing competition, which is why none of the judges could figure out he was belting out the ’90s classic “Friday I’m in Love” by The Cure. Hawk admitted to joining the show to have some fun and sang a song by The Cure in honor of his wife.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Travis Pastrana

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Lance Armstrong

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Beto O’Rourke

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: DJ Steve Aoki

Dionne Warwick as Mouse

Season 3, Episode 5

This R&B Hall of Fame singer “had a ball” playing dress up as the elegant Mouse, but her unmistakable voice made it easy for the judges to guess her identity (well, except Ken). With 56 songs charting on the Billboard Hot 100 to her credit, it is no wonder why almost everyone knew Warwick was singing “This Will Be (An Everlasting Love)” by Natalie Cole from behind the mask.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Dionne Warwick

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Dionne Warwick

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Tina Turner

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Dionne Warwick

Tom Bergeron as Taco

Season 3, Episode 6

This Emmy-winning host and comedian was flabbergasted he was able to fool the entire judging panel on “The Masked Singer” – especially considering Nicole had been on “Dancing with the Stars” and Jenny wrote a blurb on the cover of one of his books. Nonetheless, Bergeron shocked everyone when he removed the mask from his Taco suit following a performance of “Can’t Help Myself” by The Four Tops.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Martin Short

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Jerry Springer

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Martin Short

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Barry Manilow

Sarah Palin as Bear

Season 3, Episode 7

“This is something our country needs right now,” Palin expressed after removing her Bear mask and hearing a collective gasp from the studio audience on “The Masked Singer.” The judges were absolutely gobsmacked when the former governor of Alaska and Vice Presidential candidate revealed herself to be the zany creature singing “Baby Got Back” by Sir Mix-a-Lot. Palin admitted it’s the weirdest thing she’s ever done.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Tina Fey

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Candace Cameron-Bure

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Jodie Sweetin

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Christina Applegate

Bella Thorne as Swan

Season 3, Episode 8

This actress and former child model rocked the house to “I Hate Myself For Loving You” by Joan Jett & the Blackhearts and despite giving a shoutout to Ken during her performance, nobody had any clue who she was. Thorne co-starred with Ken in “The Duff” and became the second former co-star of his he failed to recognize on “The Masked Singer.”

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Nina Dobrev

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Kristen Stewart

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Olivia Munn

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Megan Fox

JoJo Siwa as T-Rex

Season 3, Episode 9

This young singer, dancer and YouTube star brought an unprecedented amount of energy to her T-Rex character. Whatever she lacked in vocals she more than compensated for with her dynamic presence, but she was still sent packing following her performance of “Jai Ho! (You Are My Destiny)” by A.R. Rahman & The Pussycat Dolls.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: JoJo Siwa

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: JoJo Siwa

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Liza Koshy

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: JoJo Siwa

Rob Gronkowski as White Tiger

Season 3, Episode 10

This three-time Super Bowl champion for the New England Patriots brought his passion and unorthodox dance moves to the stage, making it all the way to the Super 9 of Season 3 despite having no musical skills. Gronkowski’s last performance of “I’m Too Sexy” by Right Said Fred was enough for half the judging panel to guess his identity.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Rob Gronkowski

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Rob Gronkowski

Ken Jeong’s final guess: J.J. Watt

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Jon Cena

Jordyn Woods as Kangaroo

Season 3, Episode 11

This plus size supermodel and former bestie to billionaire Kylie Jenner made a splash as the feisty, yet sexy Kangaroo. Following a year of bad press, Woods hoped to show the world a different side of herself and impressed audiences with a voice she didn’t even know she had. Woods was unmasked after her performance of “No Air” by Jordin Sparks and Jenny was the only judge who guessed her identity.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: La La Anthony

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Jordyn Woods

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Cat Deeley

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Blac Chyna

Bret Michaels as Banana

Season 3, Episode 12

For weeks the panelists were convinced the yellow fruit was actually a blue collar comedian, naming Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall and even Larry the Cable Guy. But when Banana revealed he didn’t have a background in comedy, Jenny (and soon two other judges) shifted focus to Michaels.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Bret Michaels

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Bret Michaels

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Brad Paisley

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Bret Michaels

Hunter Hayes as Astronaut

Season 3, Episode 13

The renowned country singer hid his true identity by taking on all other music genres, but Nicole wasn’t fooled. She was the only panelist who knew Hayes was hiding inside the Astronaut costume thanks in part to a “birthday party” clue she realized was a Fourth of July concert in which they performed together.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Jonathan Taylor Thomas

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Ben Platt

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Skylar Astin

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Hunter Hayes

Jackie Evancho as Kitty

Season 3, Episode 14

No one was more shocked to see Evancho hiding behind the Kitty mask than Nick, who first met her 10 years earlier when she was a finalist on “America’s Got Talent.” Evancho decided to put on the sultry costume so that people would see a different side of her now that she’s all grown up.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Ashley Tisdale

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Lea Michele

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Anna Kendrick

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Vanessa Hudgens

Barry Zito as Rhino

Season 3, Episode 15

Stop the presses! For the first time in Season 3, Ken correctly guessed the identity of the unmasked singer. Of course, he stole Jenny’s guess from weeks earlier, but that didn’t really matter in the long run. Ken was convinced after a “JAG” clue pointed to Zito being a guest star on CBS’s Navy drama, of which Ken was a superfan.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Trace Adkins

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Barry Zito

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Barry Zito

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Jason Aldean

Bow Wow as Frog

Season 3 Finale (Third Place)

Despite being a front-runner all season long, this rapping and hip-hopping amphibian had to settle for third place in the grand finale. Two of the panelists correctly guessed Bow Wow’s true identity, while the other two were ribbittingly wrong.

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Bow Wow

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Lil’ Romeo

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Kid Cudi

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Bow Wow

Jesse McCartney as Turtle

Season 3 Finale (Runner-up)

Throughout the season the panelists’ guesses included every boy band member known to man, but in the end it proved to be singer-songwriter McCartney. One of the physical clues, a photo album, notably teased the heartthrob’s early career as an actor on soap opera “All My Children.”

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Adam Lambert

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Jesse McCartney

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Nick Jonas

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Jesse McCartney

Kandi Burruss as Night Angel

Season 3 Finale (Winner)

At long last, the winner of the third Golden Mask was revealed to be business mogul/Grammy-winning songwriter/realty TV star Burruss. “It feels incredible!” said the show’s first-ever female winner. “For a long time I really stopped singing by myself … and I really appreciate you guys for helping me build my confidence back up.”

Robin Thicke’s final guess: Kandi Burruss

Jenny McCarthy’s final guess: Kandi Burruss

Ken Jeong’s final guess: Tisha Campbell

Nicole Scherzinger’s final guess: Taraji P. Henson

Busta Rhymes as Dragon

Season 4, Episode 1

Despite the rapper having an identifiably gravelly voice, he fooled half of the panelists, with only Robin Thicke and Nicole Scherzinger guessing correctly. “I felt like I was in an oxygen tank without oxygen,” Busta Rhymes declared in his post-show interview.

Robin’s first impression: Busta Rhymes

Robin’s final guess: Busta Rhymes

Jenny’s first impression: Adrian Peterson

Jenny’s final guess: DMX

Ken’s first impression: Marshawn Lynch

Ken’s final guess: Michael Phelps

Nicole’s first impression: Busta Rhymes

Nicole’s final guess: Busta Rhymes

Mickey Rourke as Gremlin

Season 4, Episode 2

In a “Masked Singer” first, Mickey Rourke decided he was too hot inside the costume and so he self-eliminated before the voting process even began. Amazingly, Jenny McCarthy still guessed the raspy-voiced actor correctly. Unfortunately, Nicole Scherzinger didn’t even get to guess because Rourke removed his mask beforehand.

Robin’s first impression: N/A

Robin’s final guess: Jerry Lee Lewis

Jenny’s first impression: Mickey Rourke

Jenny’s final guess: Mickey Rourke

Ken’s first impression: N/A

Ken’s final guess: Steve Austin

Nicole’s first impression: N/A

Nicole’s final guess: N/A

Brian Austin Green as Giraffe

Season 4, Episode 3

Even though Brian Austin Green was childhood friends with Robin Thicke, the judge failed to guess his secret identity. Guest panelist Joel McHale came the closest when he thought the Giraffe was actually “Beverly Hills 90210” star Jason Priestley.

Robin’s first impression: Jaleel White

Robin’s final guess: Travis Barker

Jenny’s first impression: Travis Barker

Jenny’s final guess: Seth Green

Ken’s first impression: Will.I.Am

Ken’s final guess: Shia LaBeouf

Nicole’s first impression: Dale Earnhardt Jr.

Nicole’s final guess: Dale Earnhardt Jr.

Mark Sanchez as Baby Alien

Season 4, Episode 4

This character made “Masked Singer” history as the first-ever puppet to take the stage. Mark Sanchez, a retired NFL quarterback and current sports commentator, was officially one of the most shocking reveals of all time, as the panelists were mostly convinced Baby Alien was a stand-up comedian.

Robin’s first impression: Triumph the Insult Comic Dog

Robin’s final guess: Jason Biggs

Jenny’s first impression: Ralph Macchio

Jenny’s final guess: Nick Kroll

Ken’s first impression: Matt LeBlanc

Ken’s final guess: Freddie Prinze Jr.

Nicole’s first impression: David Schwimmer

Nicole’s final guess: Jeff Dunham

Wendy Williams as Lips

Season 4, Episode 5

After being eliminated on her first appearance, the infamous talk show host admitted she couldn’t sing and couldn’t dance, but that she knew “how to have fun.” The two female panelists immediately recognized Wendy Williams’ trademark voice and laugh, while the two male judges were swayed by some of the clues and guessed incorrectly.

Robin’s first impression: Sandra Bernhard

Robin’s final guess: Sandra Bernhard

Jenny’s first impression: Wendy Williams

Jenny’s final guess: Wendy Williams

Ken’s first impression: Mariah Carey

Ken’s final guess: Allison Janney

Nicole’s first impression: Wendy Williams

Nicole’s final guess: Wendy Williams

Bob Saget as Squiggly Monster

Season 4, Episode 6

For the first time in Season 4, Ken Jeong correctly guessed a contestant’s true identity … and it’s all thanks to Bob Saget. The comedian and TV star was almost unanimously chosen by the panel as the Squiggly Monster, with Nicole Scherzinger being the only holdout as she thought it was “Veep” star Gary Cole instead.

Robin’s first impression: Bob Saget

Robin’s final guess: Bob Saget

Jenny’s first impression: Bob Saget

Jenny’s final guess: Bob Saget

Ken’s first impression: Fabio

Ken’s final guess: Bob Saget

Nicole’s first impression: Ying Yang Twins

Nicole’s final guess: Gary Cole
